description._content: Retirement of Bill Taplin (right) with John Ward and Caroline Vinney 'Mr Bill Taplin, a member of the staff of the Bursar's Department since June 1966, retires on 31st July. He originally joined the school as a porter but after two years was transferred to the post of Storekeeper in the Stationery Store, and this is the job that he will leave at the end of the month. During the eight years he has served behind the counter of the Store on the first floor od Cannaught House Mr taplin has maintained the outflow of stationery to a paper-hungry School with a good humour that has never failed...' LSE Magazine, June 1976, no 51, p.16 (retirements) IMAGELIBRARY/355 Persistent URL: archives.lse.ac.uk/dserve.exe?dsqServer=lib-4.lse.ac.uk&a...
